Configuring to a Promotion State

When you configure a view, a folder, or even a selection of items, you can base the configuration on a promotion state. Whether the state is assigned  to <current> or a specific view label, any view configured to a promotion state is read-only.

To base a configuration on a promotion state:

  1. For a view, select View > Select Configuration. The Select a View Configuration dialog opens. Go to step 3.

  2. For a folder or item:

    1. Select Advanced > Behavior from the Folder or component menu. The Item Behavior dialog opens.

    2. Select the Configuration tab.

    3. Go to step 3.

  3. Select the Promotion state configuration option button.

  4. Select a promotion state from the drop-down list box.

    5. If you configure a view to a promotion state, the promotion state remains dynamic. When the promotion state’s view label changes, the view is configured to the new view label on the next refresh. If you exit the view and return, you return to the current configuration.

    If you configure a folder or item to a promotion state, however, the application sets (or pins) the folder or item to the revision with the promotion state's current view label. The configuration does not change with changes to the promotion state. If you return to the dialog in which the configuration was selected, you will see the date and time of the revision as the configuration setting.
